#summary A brief overview of the additional development steps required when adding a new edge to the meta-model.
#labels Development,Phase-Implementation

[Development < Development]

=Introduction=

When adding a new edge type to the meta-model that will be created in a diagram editor, there are additional steps that must be taken, otherwise the created link may not persist across Eclipse restarts/initialize diagram.

  # [http://code.google.com/p/iaml/source/diff?spec=svn2075&r=2075&path=/trunk/org.openiaml.model/src/org/openiaml/model/helpers/EdgeTypes.java&old_path=/trunk/org.openiaml.model/src/org/openiaml/model/helpers/EdgeTypes.java&old=1664 Add the new edge type] to `org.openiaml.model.helpers.EdgeTypes`
  # [http://code.google.com/p/iaml/source/diff?spec=svn2076&r=2076&path=/trunk/org.openiaml.model.diagram.helpers/src/org/openiaml/model/diagram/helpers/GetShortcuts.java&old_path=/trunk/org.openiaml.model.diagram.helpers/src/org/openiaml/model/diagram/helpers/GetShortcuts.java&old=1736 Modify GetShortcuts.java]:
    # Add the edge type to `getAllImportantRelationships()`
    # Create a new method `getAllShortcutsFromXXXEdges()`
    # Add the edge type to `getSourceElement()`
    # Add the edge type to `getTargetElement()`

These steps are on top of the normal requirements (i.e. adding it to the ecore meta-model, and updating the diagram editors as necessary).

Ideally these steps would be created automatically (issue 183).
